data.title: Special Place for Artists
data.text: As an Art Major, and part-time artist (photography, mostly), I really have enjoyed having KIA as a creative haven in our small city. The museum is modest in size, and may not always have an exhibit that appeals to everyone, but they do a really nice job of being a place that the community can come together and share in the arts in a way that seems to be less and less appreciated in our Kardashian-filled world. The first time I went was to see the Chihuly exhibit in 2006, and it was life-altering. Such a gorgeous exhibit. The next time I went was as a student taking a weekend Platinum Printing Photography workshop over the weekend in the winter of 2016. It was like coming home to walk into the basement photo lab, smell the chemicals, and be in a room with other people who love the same things that I love, and who enjoyed seeing each other's work get printed. The instructors are a nice group of people who love making art, and love helping share their knowledge with the people who come here seeking a creative outlet to learn and hone their skills. I am currently taking a wheel pottery class, and am pleased to find that it is a little like riding a bike after 15 years out of the studio. The facilities, tools, and supplies provided to the students who attend classes are impressive and I am so glad to know that there are generous people in our community who support this facility and provide the opportunity to our community to continue participating in the arts well past our school-aged years. The classes are not intimidating, so if you are someone who loves art and wants to get started learning, no matter what age you are, or are someone who is looking to get back into the groove after some time away, sign up for a seminar or a class - you will be so happy that you did! Hope to see you there!

data.title: Nothing better than a little culture in Kzoo
data.text: Nice rotation of art and a goregous place to visit to kill a few hours on a rainy day. While the art isnt the massive exhibits you might find in bigger cities. This is a great walking tour. Now, the promotion is a little low of the exhibits and the parking is not abundant, bring your quarters for the street. But a marvelous environment.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: This is an awesome art museum with beautiful glass sculptures. Very impressed with this art museum. Would take the kids.

data.title: You could touch some of the art!
data.text: The museum is small but filled with some great and interesting pieces of art. One of the security guards noticed me admiring a piece by Renee Stout and told me I could open some of the perfume/herb bottles on display. This was not only surprising but very cool. There is also a small gift shop onsite.

data.title: Small but  interesting
data.text:
This is a working and school institute so much is off limits. And it's not large like a museum .  There is one small gallery on the first floor and about three or four in the basement . It was interesting. Particularly enjoyed the art in the basement , modern and older .
They have an elevator  and ramps so it's stroller and wheelchair accessible .  They also have a lovely gift shop near the front door where I got a terrific price on a beautiful bracelet . That offset the rather pricey entrance fee. A pleasant and rather short visit  art gallery .

data.title: Superb fine arts museum
data.text: Visitors have said the Kalamazoo Institute of Arts is the among the finest art galleries between Chicago and Detroit. It's easily accessible in downtown Kalamazoo from Interstate Highways I-94 and US-131. The modern museum features several galleries on two levels with rotating exhibitions. The new Asian gallery features the works of contemporary artists in both traditional and experimental genres, painting and multi-media. The Institute provides numerous workshops for adults & students throughout the year.  Well worth a visit at any time of year.

data.title: Great exhibits in intimate venue
data.text: While the venue is not larger, the exhibits are quite nice.  KIA is near downtown shops and restaurants, which can make for a fun afternoon or evening.

data.title: pretty place!
data.text: If you are walking around downtown, take a moment to pay a few bucks and check out the visiting and local artists showcased here. They have art classes. I haven't been but I hear they are pretty cool.

data.title: Very nice museum for a city this size
data.text: Small permanent collection and very nicely curated exhibits, often of local and regional artists. Nice gift shop as well. Attractive facility perfect for displaying art.

data.title: Great Wedding Reception Location - Great Staff
data.text: Attended a wedding reception here, and the galleries were all open while attendees were waiting for the bridal party to arrive.  Interesting exhibits throughout.  The Chihuly Glass sculpture at the entrance is really beautiful!  The staff were very kind and well informed.  Great info from the security person, and the event manager was very helpful at the end as we were cleaning up.  If you are in downtown Kalamazoo and want something interesting to do, stop by the Institute of Arts.  You won't regret it!

data.title: good to see
data.text:
Art that is definitely unusual and place to spend the day or afternoon.
Many exhibits are interesting, some you may walk by, but still a good experience

data.title: Limited Collection
data.text: While the art is not all valuable it all has value. Some for its profundity, some for its provocatity, some for proclivity. You be the judge.

data.title: LITTLE CITY - BIG CULTURE
data.text: Of special interest -the huge Helen Frakenthaler in the main lobby and the Victor Scheckrengost Jazz Bowl in the permanent collection. The special exhibits were varied and well-presented.  I had a wonderful - and educational day - here. I did not expect such a high level of cultural experience in a small city, but I was very pleasantly surprised!

data.title: A Kalamazoo Treasure Not To Be Missed
data.text: The KIA is a great place to spend a quiet afternoon.  It is a treasure house, currently featuring African folk literature, Korean sculptures, abstract paintings, and other paintings completely new to me, Egg Tempera, where the artist mixes his paints with egg yolk and water.  All fascinating.

owner_response.author: Art_SeekerKIA, Public Relations Manager at Kalamazoo Institute of Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review - and very glad you had a special time with us. Please come back this fall - new exhibitions throughout starting in November!

data.title: The tip of the iceberg for arts in the area
data.text: You'd think this smaller town wouldn't have such a vibrant arts scene, but it is led by the KIA. So much goes on here, including all kinds of world-class speakers, events, and exhibits. Of particular interest to our family is the teen classes and monthly teen night. KIA knows how to get kids and teens interested in art - and is changing lives because of it.

data.title: Very Very Nice
data.text: Took my family here for a summer time trip. Loved it was very interesting lots to see take your time and read and enjoy. Need to be quite for enjoyment, tickets were a bit high for a family of 4. Will go back they have special exhibits of artist and history well worth the time.

data.title: Amazing Summer Camps
data.text: My 8 year old son took a week long summer camp here and loved it!  The instructors were all amazing, and he was able to work on several projects throughout the week including clay, collage, painting, etc.  I would highly recommend the camp! The KIA also has amazing exhibits throughout the year.

data.title: Relaxed Atmosphere
data.text: For a smaller town, this is one of the best Art Institutes I have been in.  Not too large so you don't get tired or overwhelmed.  Has great exhibits.  A must see while in Kalamazoo!

data.title: Student
data.text: At Kalamazoo Institute of Arts I studied Sketchbook journaling and I really enjoyed the  show by Suzanne badger which the class went to. Susan taught us many techniques watercolor. She also shared with us her sketchbooks.

data.title: Don't miss this stop
data.text: You never know what you will see at this venue!  The Tiffany Exhibit last year was great and this year the winners of Art Hop graces the galleries. There are changing exhibits for all tastes. Stop in and support the arts!
